Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(2) Summary

APIs are the digital glue for how companies operate and collaborate today. This marks a fundamental shift from the original idea of APIs as technical interconnections to one of APIs as the business building blocks of digital transformation. What does this shift mean for our API practices? First and foremost, this means that thinking about an API's business value must be a fundamental part of API inception and design. But it also means that we have to think of APIs as products, meaning that good APIs should be reusable so that they become building blocks with a bigger potential. These API products need to be discoverable because APIs only create value when they are being used. This means that portals, catalogs, and marketplaces should become part of the standard API toolbox so that APIs can be easily created, published, found, tried out, and used. This end-to-end view of APIs is what we mean when we talk about a good API: It's an API that is created with a purpose and within an environment that helps making the most out of this purpose.



Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(5) What is an API?

  • An API provides access to a digitally accessible capability
  • An API should be designed with users and reuse in mind
  • An API only creates value when it is consumed by users


APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(7) What is a Product?



APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(8) Modern Products Need Platforms



APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(9) What is a Good API? Useful ≫ Discoverable ≫ Usable

  1. Useful means that it addresses consumers' Jobs to Be Done [https://hbr.org/2016/09/know-your-customers-jobs-to-be-done]
  2. Discoverable means that potential consumers have a fighting chance of finding it
  3. Usable means that the product makes it easy to get their jobs done


APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(10) API Consumers

  • APIs produce value (only) when they are used
    • External APIs allow to interface with partners or the public
    • Internal APIs use private digital building blocks
  • Start looking at APIs from a consumer point of view
    • Private APIs mostly revolve around decoupling internal teams
    • Partner APIs are driven by your ecosystem of business partners
    • Public APIs are intended to attract as many consumers as possible

(12) Securing APIs



A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(13) Securing Public Interfaces

  • API management started from the web's reverse proxy model
  • Resources should be made available while minimizing risks
  • API-specific functions started showing up (e.g., XML↔JSON)


A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(14) Supporting the API Lifecycle



A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(15) API Tooling

  • Going beyond just protecting the operational API
  • The API lifecycle supports the whole API development process
    • Design with support for following guidelines
    • Mocking to quickly allow consumers to start developing
    • Documentation to make the API easy to use for everyone
    • Testing to make sure the API works as intended
    • Monitoring to understand use and detect misuse


A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(16) APIs as Business Building Blocks



A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(17) Shifting to a Product Focus

  • Growing API landscapes mean growing complexity
  • Focus on API value over API implementation
  • Decoupling technical management from business value makes sense


A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(18) API Consumption Matters



A Short History of API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(19) Having APIs isn't Good Enough

  • APIs only provide value when they being consumed
  • API Marketing makes sure to get the most out of API products
  • Increase adoption by decoupling production and marketing

Myth #1: APIs are about Technology Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(22) A Brief History of APIs

  • Local APIs have been used since the 1940s
  • Network APIs have been used since the 1950s
  • Network APIs used to be called Protocols
  • Salesforce launched what they called APIs in February 2000
  • eBay launched their APIs in November 2000


Myth #1: APIs are about Technology Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(23) APIs Create Modular and Scalable Businesses

  • Digital Transformation
  • Move fast and break things
  • Loose coupling
  • The composable enterprise
  • The platform economy
  • The hockey stick


Myth #1: APIs are about Technology Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(24) Digital Transformation Definition

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]

(29) The 900lb Gorilla



Myth #2: API Monetization Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(30) Most API Value Creation is Indirect

  1. Using APIs to become better at internal reuse and cross-pollination
  2. Reducing friction by having teams communicate via APIs
  3. Using API First as a way to build everything as digital building blocks


Myth #3: API Platforms

Outline (Myth #3: API Platforms)

  1. APIs, Products, and API Products [6]
  2. A Short History of API Management [8]

  4. Conclusions [2]
Myth #3: API Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(32) What is a Platform?

  1. A developer platform that provides support for developing applications
  2. An API platform for discovering digital building blocks
  3. A platform business as a specific way to design & scale a business model


Myth #3: API Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(33) But we're not Uber…

  • Pure platform businesses are fascinating but rare
  • Find a way how to platformize aspects of your value streams
  • Business input is essential and APIs are just the means to an end

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(35) Getting APIs to Work

  • (Good) APIs are the building blocks of digital transformation → API Products
  • APIs are about collaboration so make them easy to find and use → API Marketplaces
  • Make sure that business models and API landscapes are co-evolving → API Economy


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?
